body: Among the underlying components of the S&P 500 index, we saw noteworthy options trading volume today in Netflix Inc. (Symbol: NFLX), where a total of 63,216 contracts have traded so far, representing approximately 6.3 million underlying shares. That amounts to about 69.6% of NFLX's average daily trading volume over the past month of 9.1 million shares. Particularly high volume was seen for the $140 strike call option expiring February 17, 2017 , with 5,737 contracts trading so far today, representing approximately 573,700 underlying shares of NFLX. Below is a chart showing NFLX's trailing twelve month trading history, with the $140 strike highlighted in orange: Whole Foods Market, Inc. (Symbol: WFM) saw options trading volume of 17,913 contracts, representing approximately 1.8 million underlying shares or approximately 43.6% of WFM's average daily trading volume over the past month, of 4.1 million shares. Particularly high volume was seen for the $33 strike call option expiring May 19, 2017 , with 4,148 contracts trading so far today, representing approximately 414,800 underlying shares of WFM. Below is a chart showing WFM's trailing twelve month trading history, with the $33 strike highlighted in orange: And Caterpillar Inc. (Symbol: CAT) saw options trading volume of 19,946 contracts, representing approximately 2.0 million underlying shares or approximately 42.4% of CAT's average daily trading volume over the past month, of 4.7 million shares. Particularly high volume was seen for the $90 strike put option expiring May 19, 2017 , with 1,074 contracts trading so far today, representing approximately 107,400 underlying shares of CAT. Below is a chart showing CAT's trailing twelve month trading history, with the $90 strike highlighted in orange: For the various different available expirations for NFLX options , WFM options , or CAT options , visit StockOptionsChannel.com. Today's Most Active Call & Put Options of the S&P 500 Â»
title: Noteworthy Wednesday Option Activity: NFLX, WFM, CAT
